data.title: HOP Songs Of The 2000s
data.meta_description: This blog post unveils the Top 40 influential R&B/Hip-Hop tracks of the 2000s, a list meticulously compiled from the year-end Billboard R&B/Hip-Hop
data.text:
Top 40 R&B/HIP-HOP Songs Of The 2000s

This blog post unveils the Top 40 influential R&B/Hip-Hop tracks of the 2000s, a list meticulously compiled from the year-end Billboard R&B/Hip-Hop charts. These charts reflect the era’s most beloved tunes, spanning a decade marked by musical evolution and rich diversity.

Drawn from a variety of sources, including national and local radio airplay, US streaming, and digital downloads, these rankings showcase the soundtrack of the early millennium.

Over time, the naming conventions for these charts have evolved, reflecting changes in the music industry and consumer preferences, from “Hot Rhythm & Blues Singles” to the current “HOT R&B/HIP-HOP SONGS.”

Table of Contents

2001

2002

2003

2004

2005

2006

2007

2008

2009

What was the #1 R&B song in 2000?

The #1 R&B song 2000 was “Say My Name” by Destiny’s Child. This track is a standout example of the 2000 R&B songs, showcasing the vibrant and expressive style that defined the era’s music.

It was a major hit, reflecting the trends and sounds that were prevalent in 2000s R&B, making it a classic piece in the catalog of 2000s R&B album songs.

What was the number one song in 2000 hip hop?

The number one song in 2000 within the hip-hop genre was “Hot Boyz” by Missy Elliott, featuring Nas, Eve, and Q-Tip. This track dominated the charts and exemplified the innovative and dynamic nature of 2000s hip-hop album songs.

Its success highlights the crossover appeal and the blending of genres characteristic of 2000s hip-hop and R&B songs, solidifying its place in the top 100 R&B songs of the 2000s.
